website_summaries.verdict: As long as the thicker straps don't bother you, this sports bra is an ideal choice for full busted women seeking ample support.
pros: Stands out for its superior encapsulation and compression support -- an ideal combination for high-impact sports
cons: The straps are a bit thick and wide, meaning that they can easily show through thinner material and non-athletic clothing

customer_reviews.title: Check date on reviews--Quality has gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: Quality has gone downhill since I first purchased in 2010. Fabric is flimsier. Band has been changed and rides up on the first wearing. Straps wrinkle. The inner elastic band is obviously of lesser quality. I still have the ones I originally purchased and they are almost in as good condition as some new ones I just bought. I loved the original Fiona (which a lot of these reviews are for--check the dates). It's disappointing when American companies cut corners on their goods and expect us to pay the same prices for less quality.
customer_reviews.author: CAA in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Best running bra (and nursing bra) :)
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly enough, I first started using this bra for breastfeeding after my son was born. I was desperate for a supportive comfortable bra, and it was a bonus that the straps were adjustable and came down in the front for easy access. But, that was about a year ago and these bras are now my go to workout bra , especially for running! They wash up nicely (if you don't put them in the dryer) and are built to last. The material is very soft and forms to your body. True to size, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy
customer_reviews.text: Hands down one of the best/most comfortable sports bras I have ever had. Bonus that it isn’t outrageously expensive. I’m not large chested but I do a lot of high impact (read: extremely chest bounce inducing) sports and it definitely keeps said bouncing in check! Also bonus that it hooks in the back so taking it off is not an additional work out. My only issue is I really want the white one and it seems to always be sold out in my size. I also wish they made a nude colored one. Definitely gonna order more though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not supportive enough
customer_reviews.text: The material is too thin. It's soft and comfortable but not supportive enough. Headlights are definitely still on. Moving Comfort used to make the Juno sports bra which I was a HUGE fan of. However, once Brooks took over Moving Comfort, then changed the JUNO bra and it's much thinner and less supportive than it used to be. So, I was looking for a replacement but this isn't going to work. It's so hard to find a quality sports bra. These companies are charging $50+ dollars for these things and the quality and support are inadequate. It's so frustrating. Bring back the old Juno!
customer_reviews.author: Laura H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for large breasted jogging or surgical recovery.
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile and comfortable large breast sports bra. My first one was used for running with a 40DDD chest! I quit running after a couple of months, not because of breast bounce pain...but my knee. In 2013 at 54 I had breast cancer 'lumpectomy' surgery along with a reduction. I found this bra model essential! Much better than the three different surgical recovery bras I'd purchased in advance to be prepared. It is a soft, compressive and yet a very adjustable bra. It can change sizes as the swelling goes down. Order your usual band size and go down on your normal cup size as the adjustable straps help determine your 'cup' fit and support.
customer_reviews.author: Slipflash

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sports bra!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite sports bra and I wear it when doing yoga and lifting weights. Actually, I'd wear it all day if I thought I could get away with it. It's that comfy. The company, on the other hand, is one of the worst I've ever dealt with anywhere in my entire life. They've sent me the wrong item twice and charge to return something PLUS a restocking fee. BUY THIS BRA ... but elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth J.

customer_reviews.title: Protect those boobies
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend has delicious, round, full, amazing looking 32DD boobies. The only problem with having them is that they are big and heavy and flop around when we run. It is difficult to find adequate boob holsters at a running store since they usually stock sizes for much smaller boobies. While we run I usually totally stare at them an zone out, which I did again this time as well. It wasn't out of pure arousal like usual, but total disbelief! It was like they had been in the freezer overnight! They weren't moving at all. If you have a girlfriend with a great rack, get her a great bra!
customer_reviews.author: JoshuaBTC

customer_reviews.title: a smoother material would be nice. Outside of that this is the best sports ...
customer_reviews.text: Why is this bra cost as much as I would pay in the running store, plus I'd have to pay an extra $9 for shipping? I've been buying this bra on Amazon for several years now, and used to pay only $25 per bra. I will go to the running store, it will be cheaper. I would give the Fiona bra 5 stars if it weren't for the ribbed band that goes around the chest that leaves in imprint in my skin, a smoother material would be nice. Outside of that this is the best sports bra I've found for someone that is big chested. I usually wear a 34DD, but by this in a 34D.
customer_reviews.author: rainbow

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This bra is pretty good for non-running, but I’ve been a Juno fanatic for several years now and this one just doesn’t measure up. It’s basically a slightly moew supportive rebound racer. I wish I would have ordered 36d instead of 36dd. Too much movement. Will keep because I’m pretty sure that’s the only option I have but will stick to the junos from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel L Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great bra!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the most comfortable bra I've ever worn. The straps don't dig in and I really like the velcro section in front that is how you adjust the length. The fabric is soft and, well, it's just about perfect. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Farm wife

customer_reviews.title: Supportive
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work out for wearing with a backpack. The straps are too thick, and they were crushed under the pack straps. I had to skip wearing it until the backpack part of the trip was over and wear it only on the restful days at the end of the trail. But, honestly, I didn't need a bra like this to go walking down the trail for weeks on end.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a band size 34, and it is 28 inches. I can squeeeeze into it very uncomfortably, and since they don't provide a size up I will have to make it work. Hopefully the hooks hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Smist

customer_reviews.title: Favorite high-impact sports bra!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a number of sports bras, and this is hands-down my favorite. I use this for distance running (half marathon and longer) and HIIT classes with a lot of jumping, so having high support without chafing is important. Since this doesn't have an underwire or cup support I didn't expect it to be very supportive: but it works! I've purchased this in a few different colors. I've sometimes had a bit of chafing at the bottom band after 2+ hours of activity unless I use an anti-chafing product, but it's still by far the best I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea K (chelscore)

customer_reviews.title: Not a good work out bra.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, I took a chance. I tried another Moving Comfort bra after they discontinued the old Maia bra (which was PERFECT, the new Maia is awful.) This Fiona bra rolls up from the bottom, wadding up under the girls. The shoulder straps are stiff and I can't wear it for weight lifting. <sigh> I refuse to spend a fortune trying to find a good sports bra, especially since one existed at one time - the old Maia bra!
customer_reviews.author: angartist

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: 36DD.. This is the best sports bra for day to day wear. I have three now, and wear them to work every day. They give enough support and compression for my line of work. For more active days, I wear the Juno model from Moving Comfort, but it really wears on my shoulders, as it is a racer back, I deal with it though, because it offers just enough protection (formed cups) to keep me from being embarrassed on cold days. The fiona has no protection like that, but is more comfortable, so 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tlamb

customer_reviews.title: I loved my Moving Comfort Fiona Bras
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Moving Comfort Fiona Bras. I'm an aerobic instructor and I swore by them for years... and then I had a baby. I wore the 34C pre baby and have found the 36D fits best post baby, but I feel there is something missing in these since I've had my son. I believe it may be the thickness of the material? Anyway, these are great for smaller chests and pre baby body, but I have switched to the Victoria's Secret Incredible Sports Bra recently as I feel they give better support and coverage.
customer_reviews.author: W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: No bouncing for this first time breastfeeder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after the birth of my twins because my old sports bras were not providing the support needed to run now that I am breastfeeding. I have gone from an A/B cup that didn't need much support to a large D. This bra truly delivered. There is no bouncing. I cannot give 5 stars because it is not a racer-back design, making a lot of other things I do during a workout slightly impeded. For example, the bra is very restrictive when trying to do rows. It's good for running or other high impact sports, but not for activities requiring upper body flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: L. Eckman

customer_reviews.title: I Can Actually Run Wearing This!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that another reviewer said to buy a sports bra in a size that fits too tight. That is exactly what I had to do for my first order. My measurements were above the MC size chart. I got the biggest size that I would fit into and I had no problems doing jump jacks or running. I actually felt great and didn't get winded wearing this bra and my breasts didn't feel as though they were going to bounce off either. Now I fit within the MC size chart and will be ordering a new one very soon. I love this sports bra! You cannot beat a deal like this.
customer_reviews.author: Reading For a Lifetime

customer_reviews.title: Best sports bra ever
customer_reviews.text: Moving comfort makes the best sports bras I've ever tried for running. No bouncing, total comfort. I wear a 38D, and I've never had a negative experience in this bra. If you're running in hot weather, you may need body glide to prevent chafing, but otherwise, it's completely perfect. Before finding this bra, I would wear two bras at once. With this one, there's no need. Only bra you'll ever need for running.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Best sports bra in the world!
customer_reviews.text: I did end up returning this bra for a smaller size. A lot smaller. However, that was my mistake in choosing the correct size. (Busy mom ordering online problem). Anyhow, I've been using this brand and particular bra for years and have never found a better bra. I have what you could call an ample bosom but I love high impact workouts from jogging to step to zumba. You can't really get the support and comfort you need for D Cups in other sports bras. Even the ones with underwire (ouch!). The point is that when I wear this bra, the girls stay where I put them and that doesn't only help you look better, but you feel comfortable. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Weird fit.
customer_reviews.text: I realize all bras fit every women differently but this bra was the weirdest fit of bra I’ve ever worn. It also made wrinkles that would show through my shirt and just looked bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect sports bra
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 38B in daily bras, bought the 40B and it fits perfectly. The straps adjust with velcro at the front, once you have them set you probably won't ever touch them again. Fabric wicks well; good support for walking & light jogging. Nice coverage at the sides & back. The only thing keeping this from a 5-star rating is that the outer layer is not sewing to the inner layer at the bottom band, so it rolls. I can see why they didn't, it makes for a smoother look - but a row of stitching about an inch up from the bottom band would have made the layers stay together better.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for my needs
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I've tried on literally dozens of sports bras to find one that gave enough support and still let me breathe! That brand isn't made anymore, so I started the hunt all over again. Luckily, this was my first try, and I hit the jackpot! I forget I have it on, it's that comfortable! The arm straps and rib cage straps are all adjustable. It looks nice, and could easily be worn alone as an exercise top. In addition, since it hooks in the back like a regular bra, there's no struggle to get it on and off. I'll be getting more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Not discreet
customer_reviews.text: I must be the only one with pokey nipples. This doesn't seem to be a concern for anyone else, but I prefer to work out without my headlights on. The thin nylon material doesn't offer any coverage. I will continue to search for the right workout bra. Also, the band around the bottom rolls up.
customer_reviews.author: ambs

customer_reviews.title: Great bra for sports and rotator cuff surgery
customer_reviews.text: Fits well. Is comfortable and soft, plus durable and has velcro straps that you can adjust from the front, so is good for one-armed action after rotator cuff surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Reader

customer_reviews.title: Que milagro!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly the "Miracle Bra". I"ve been blessed (cursed?) with a 36 DD rack and this durable bra has kept me running for over 10 years. Even after years and years of abuse, they still hold up. Absolutely one of the most important purchases I"ve ever made. Can't recommend it highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: Mbra

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have been using moving comfort as an exercise bra and a daily bra for 2 years. It is great for exercise and as far as daily use it acts as a minimizer bra, decreases rolls and is very comfortable. It doesn't put tension on the neck like other exercise bras. I highly recommend this bra for larger sized women. Since I wear this bra everyday, I bought one for exercise and one for daily use. The first time I bought this the cost was much higher because I bought it somewhere else on line. The Amazon price was incredible! I suggest replacing the bra once a year if you wear it often.
customer_reviews.author: manderson

customer_reviews.title: Supportive, but not perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the Fiona forever. I'm super busty, so just this bra isn't enough. I always layer it with a cheap racerback, and it's perfect when it's combined with a little extra compression. All the fancy sports bras with wire are painful when I run, I hate padding, and I've found that no matter what I pay, I have to layer anyway, so I just stick with the Fiona. I love the adjustable velcro straps, and I think the material is great for keeping me as dry as possible. I always size down with these bras to make sure they fit as snugly as possible. They also last forever and come in lots of pretty colors!
customer_reviews.author: M. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Holds Them Down!!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this exercise bra because of the reviews I read! I must say that I agree! This is a great exercise bra for active full-breasted women! I have a 5k and will wear it tomorrow! I love the velcro adjustable straps and the full coverage this bra gives. It holds them down while exercising without being too snug as to cause discomfort. You can still breathe without feeling smothered. and it's not so tight that you feel like a can of busted biscuits with meat spilling out over and under the bra. Your exercise top will look nice over it.
customer_reviews.author: MizzMello

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love these sports bras. I’m a 32DDD and I order a cup smaller to ensure good support. The 32DD’s fit with amazing support and are very comfortable. I ordered 2 and once they were delivered I ordered 2 more. Shipped quicker than quoted also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so comfy
customer_reviews.text: These bras are great! Gave 4 stars because the size between colors differs. I am normally a 36DD but I took the review suggestions and purchased a 34DD. I received a black and white bra. The white one fit perfectly, but the black one was a little tight... I'll return it for a 36DD. Still very satisfied. Now I only have to wear one bra working out! Oh, and I haven't experienced uniboob so far, however... with my moisture wicking work out shirts, this bra does show when you are cold!! Regular cotton shirts, it doesn't show. Great product... extremely surprised and satisfied!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: My search for a good sports bra for big boobs is over!
customer_reviews.text: Yahoo. The first sports bra that actually really minimizes bounce so I wasn't self conscious doing jumpy moves at Zumba. I tried wacoal's sports bra ( I love the regular bras) and it did nothing and I tried multiple sizes of the much celebrated panache bra and the cups were all bunchy even going down several cup sizes from my usual. Anyhow so glad to have found this bra and now I've ordered two more. Yeah that these are less expensive too. For large breasts, I don't know if zero bounce is possible but this was the best I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Actually comfortable for holding you in place
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how comfortable this bra is! It totally holds you in place yet it isn't tight, there isn't an underwire, and it doesn't have grandma cone cups! Its soft and looks similar to smaller bust size sports bras, not the ugly industrial big girl bras with tons of ugly fabric and wires. I'm pregnant and it is still comfortable enough to wear around the house. I would recommend this bra to anyone who actually needs a "real" sports bra (ie C cup or up).
customer_reviews.author: Anya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for big chested girls
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of cardio/running/interval training and I have double D's, so finding a good sports bra is important! This one works perfectly. It holds me in, I'm not bouncing around and it's comfortable. I really like the adjustable straps. It does slightly shrink when washed though. I'm a 32DD, my first Fiona Bra was a 32D, which held me in great, until it started to shrink. This time around I bought a 34D, I've washed it once and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: TheresaK

customer_reviews.title: Great for post-surgical recovery
customer_reviews.text: This is well fitting and well made. The front adjusting straps with velcro were particularly useful in arranging the comfort. I tried many different brands but purchased 3 of these and sent the others all back. My main complaint is that it does not come in a smaller cup size. The B cup is not really compressive enough for size A, but all the A cups bras were poorly made. I nearly gave it 4 stars for this reason, but wanted to let surgery patients know the benefits of this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Sports Bra
customer_reviews.text: This is the only sports bra I will wear. I wear 38D, and it fits perfectly. I love the wide adjustable straps, they are comfortable and do not leave dents in my shoulders. I use this bra for rebound jumping, weight lifting, and many water sports, and it keeps my chest secure with no bounce.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Sports Bra
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd honestly find a sports bra that fit my chest until I met the Moving Comfort Fiona. Although they can be somewhat pricey, they fit my body like a glove and hold me in place when I run, walk, hike, bike, etc. Not only that, but the material is very comfortable. After trying two cheaper brands in hopes of saving money, I learned that these bras are simply worth shelling out the big bucks (note: sometimes they are on sale, though). I have not been able to find anything as good as this bra.
customer_reviews.author: merryberry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bra
customer_reviews.text: The Moving Comfort bras are awesome. I have a few different styles and I like them all, however, the Fiona bra was easiest to put on and take off because of the hooks in the back. I was concerned that it wouldn't be as supportive as the racerback bras that I'm used to, but this one is so comfortable and very supportive for my full bust (38DD). I must admit that I have not done any high impact activities in this bra, however, I have no doubt that it will be supportive regardless of the activity.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Lia

customer_reviews.title: So Comfy...Not COMPLETELY effective in stopping bouncing
customer_reviews.text: Even though this bra is not entirely effective in stopping the bounce (I'm 38D), it does hold enough though that the bouncing doesn't hurt, and it's not uncomfortable. I still give it 5 stars though because it is so comfortable compared to other bras that had underwire, which would eventually start to poke through. Also straps on my last bra had a seam that rubbed my shoulders and gave me a rash, but this bra has a unique strap with no seam. It holds up well in the wash too. I hang dry it though, although it did get into the dryer once on accident and it is still fine.
customer_reviews.author: smurpette

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive & great for breastfeeding
customer_reviews.text: After looking at several sports bras online & in person, I think this is the perfect supportive sports bra for nursing mothers. I was a little leery of the velcro on the straps, but it is soft & holds well. I love that I can loosen it for lower intensity activities or tighten it for higher impact activities. I can comfortably run while wearing this sports bra! Also, the velcro straps allow for easy access for nursing my baby. All around one of the best sports bras I've ever owned. An added bonus: the pricing on the white bra is greatly discounted!
customer_reviews.author: litlckrets

customer_reviews.title: I'm a moving comfort-vangelist
customer_reviews.text: This bra makes me want to stop every larger-chested lady at the gym and say, "Hey, have you ever heard of Moving Comfort?" I don't even have that big of a chest, but I'm currently nursing and any little bounce can be excruciating. Another mom at the gym recommended this bra because not only does it fit great, look good, and hold the ladies firmly in place, it's comfortable and easy to nurse in. The straps just happen to adjust via velcro loops in the front, which makes them both super adjustable for comfort and easy to detach for access!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice for equestrians
customer_reviews.text: This Bra is perfect for high support. As an equestrian I needed something that could withstand the vigor’s of a horses gate. This was a great addition to my clothing line. The easily adjustable straps helped me tighten it when I needed a bit extra support. Great for riding!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Moving comfort or bust! (Pun intended.)
customer_reviews.text: I have a few moving comfort bras and they have all been great! I am a full D cup and this is the only bra that I have found so far that gives me the kind of support I need for high impact exercises. (Like running or jumping etc.) I also like that it's good looking doesn't give you the uniboob look. The back clasps are also a nice touch because you don't have to try and pull it off overhead which can be difficult to do when you're all sweaty after a workout. All in all Moving Comfort makes some great bras and this one is my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Good - yes, Great - no
customer_reviews.text: This bra in a nutshell in my size 44DD: Pros - - very full coverage, nothing spilling out from any side. - soft, comfortable material. - sturdy, very little jiggle. Cons - - my nipples show through - uni-boob - rolls up a little bit in the back Side note: I am nursing my baby and while the Velcro straps do make it easy to unhook the strap, but it isn't the easiest to reattach. Overall, this bra is better than most, but If you are looking for perfect, this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Shoptan

customer_reviews.title: From one active nursing mama to another...buy this bra!
customer_reviews.text: For any nursing mamas who want to stay active, THIS is a GREAT bra. The velcro straps make it so easy to have access to the breast while not feeling like you're completely loosing support! As I am not currently running in it, I'm not sure how it measures up in the whole "no-bounce" area, but I rarely ever feel like I'm flouncing around the house in this! Now if I could only find a regular bra that could work as well as this one! Highly recommended, well fitted to size, easy to wash, easy and comfy to wear!
customer_reviews.author: Abswclfx

customer_reviews.title: Sad they changed the materials.
customer_reviews.text: This used to be my go-to bra as a chesty athlete. Very frustrated they changed the way they manufacture this bra since it was taken over by Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Sports Bra
customer_reviews.text: It kept my boobs from moving, I'm 5'1 and I wear a 34 DD. It fits perfect, I highly recommend to anyone with big boobs.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Higgenbottom

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant purchase
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this sports bra. It is perfectly supportive... I used to resort to wearing two sports bras in an attempt to keep my girls stable and now I just need one!!! I am so happy with my purchase. I believe the size is true to life...though I can never actually find my true size in stores. I use the during my Power 90 work outs which require quite a lot of jumping and bouncing. The first time I used it I was shocked at how much, not only were my girls previously in the way, but they were slowing me down! Totally improved my workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki G.

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sports bra in a 32D based on reviews that said it is "true to VS sizes", but I did not find this to be true. My VS size is 32D, but the cup size on this bra is huge. I plan on returning it, but I'm debating going down to a B or C cup size (it's really that big). Chest size fits perfect though. I do love that it functions like a regular bra with the back closure since I do the "sports bra hop" to get out of my other MC bras. I just can't give it a better rating because I can't wear it in the size I got.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Comfort is the word
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable bra. I am not a serious runner, but I do light jogging, jump jacks etc. I find this bra to better than other sports bra's I have tried and far more comfortable. Found it easy to put on and take off. My shoulders and upper arms have pain when they are raised mid height, so having the back hook is wonderful. I have actually become stuck when putting on a bra that slips over my head. The bra minimizes bounce, straps stay up, yet I don't feel like I'm taped up. I will buy more of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wdrop

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase a sports bra off the internet without trying it on because I do have rather large breasts (40C), but I was pleasantly surprised with the fit. It is true to size and looks exactly as pictured. Even though you do get a uniboob look,you know this bra is doing it's job with the great support it provides. The velco straps haven't posed any problems, but I don't quite understand why the maker just didn't use conventional adjustment straps. I will purchase another one shortly in a different color. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Flower0813

customer_reviews.title: The perfect running bra for larger women
customer_reviews.text: I tried no less than four other brands of running bras supposedly great for larger busted women. None of them really held the "girls" in place and I'd get sore from a run. I'm a 36 DD. THIS bra works miracles and I've purchased four of them since the first one. The "girls" don't move and the bra is comfortable, too. The adjustable shoulder straps are awesome. I recommend this bra to other women who are "gifted on top."
customer_reviews.author: Kira Perdue

customer_reviews.title: Better option is La Isla
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 4 stars based on what I paid for this a year ago (almost half what it is now), but it is way overpriced now. This bra is not perfect but it is one of a few that actually has almost no bounce. The La Isla High Impact Sports Bra is a much better option and is only a third of what the Fiona cost. It is almost identical but the straps of La Isla are much wider and the band is more comfortable. Moving Comfort, you and your greed have lost you a fan and customer.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: I hope you don't have nipples
customer_reviews.text: I'm a usual 38D, but I ordered a 36D for the support. It's fine along the ribs, but still leaves a lot of bounce. Also, trying this on indoors, I was a bit horrified to see it didn't do anything to conceal nipples. It isn't cold inside and I'd say I'm average in that department, but they were... Very showcased with this sports-bra. Hoping it would go away once I put a shirt on, I tried. No avail, though. I have never once had this problem, but it looks the same as if I hadn't worn a bra at all.
customer_reviews.author: H. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great for exercise, even greater nursing bra!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this bra for exercise walking. I absolutely loved it - great support for my large chest (36D), and much less of a "uniboob" look than many sports bras! It's very comfortable, and has great support without feeling too tight. I bought 5 more. The wonderful surprise was after I had a baby. These have become my go-to nursing bras! The velcro straps make nursing easy, while still having great support. Regular nursing bras are useless to me - no support, and my breasts fall out of the top. Thank you, Moving Comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: No bounce, but comfort suffers
customer_reviews.text: So, I love the color, and I was impressed that nothing moved during cardio (DD), but the band underneath the bustline is insanely itchy to me. Only in the front; back is fine. It feels soft enough to the touch, but it rubs quite a bit and makes the cost outweighs the benefit of keeping things in place. Have not experienced the band flipping out/up as other reviewers have. Update: I have now experienced the band flipping out. Not a fan of this sports bra sadly. Who makes the ones for Biggest Looser? I need one of those!
customer_reviews.author: aciras

customer_reviews.title: Great for Larger Busts
customer_reviews.text: I have had the hardest time finding sports bras over the years that would actually keep me in place while exercising. This bra is fabulous. The girls don't move at all!! Also, unlike bras that go over your head or only fasten in the back, this bra is very easy to get into...and out of. It washes easily too. I have a pink one and this black one. The fabric and the colors have stayed nicely after quite a bit of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jaline

customer_reviews.title: Great for Larger Busts
customer_reviews.text: I have had the hardest time finding sports bras over the years that would actually keep me in place while exercising. This bra is fabulous. The girls don't move at all!! Also, unlike bras that go over your head or only fasten in the back, this bra is very easy to get into...and out of. It washes easily too. I have a black one and this pink one. The fabric and the colors have stayed nicely after quite a bit of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jaline

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Support for jumping/jogging
customer_reviews.text: Best sports bra for nursing moms EVER! I am normally a full C cup and have ballooned to a DD/E while nursing. I tried several bras and was still uncomf trying to jog -- but this one holds the girls in place comfortably and is easy to nurse with. And I like that it clasps in the back so it's easy to put on/take off. I'm still going to wear this bra even after I'm done nursing because it has such great support.
customer_reviews.author: Hollyskye

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Will not wear another type of bra this one rocks
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Best sports bra for larger breasts!
customer_reviews.text: Great sports bra for larger breasts! They won’t move at all!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Wykle

customer_reviews.title: THIS SPORTS BRA IS AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 36DD and this bra not only fits perfectly and holds my breasts in place while jogging but it's made out of a quick drying material. it's got great support even for larger ladies and the straps are also adjustable. It's not cheap but it's well worth it. I'll be buying a couple more in the near future as I replace my cheaper quality ones I mistakenly bought.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great for nursing!
customer_reviews.text: This product is not marketed as a nursing bra but it works great! I can use it as a high intensity sports bra as well as nursing because the strap can be unhooked in the front. The fit is very tight, which is necessary for running. I've bought many sports bras attempting to comfortably run and breastfeed (not at the same time =) -- this is the first one that works and supports perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great for those with large cup sizes
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 36C so finding a great bra for the gym is important. I use the elliptical & take tabata. If lthe bra straps are adjusted perfectly each time I put the bra on then I get minimum chest movement. I didn't rate this higher because ideally I want no chest movement plus I don't feel this bra would be good for higher impact activities. On the plus side this bra is lightweight, & dosen't come up to my neck like other large cup sports bras. Overall this is a good bra but the search for something better continues...
customer_reviews.author: sienna2125

customer_reviews.title: Extraordinary
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's snug. But comfortable. And no bouncing! By some miracle this bra holds you tight without pinching or digging. The construction and fabric are excellent quality too. I was concerned the first time I put it on because I had to do the "grandma" move and latch the hooks in front and spin it around - thought for sure this thing was gonna be too tight and rub me raw. But it fits so wonderfully and is now my favorite high impact bra. I can't imagine it gets better than this bra. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Vago

customer_reviews.title: Good fit.. bad design
customer_reviews.text: It's okay.. what I didn't like about it was how the velcro messes the straps up from the velcro. When you pull the strap in it snags the material. I also don't like how it's not easy to fish the straps through the holes. Especially if you are holding your baby and trying to fish a strap through a hole that is getting stuck on the fabric. I think the design wasn't thought out completely and the holes should have some rubber or something there that wouldn't get messed up and would make the straps easier to slide in and out. The fit was nice but I never wear it because I hate dealing with the straps.
customer_reviews.author: USMCRAJUWIFE

customer_reviews.title: I've bought this many times
customer_reviews.text: And find this to be a great sports bra. I need a lot of support, but don't like to feel like I have a straight jacket on. This does the trick. The only one thing I would like for Moving Comfort product managers to know is it would be nice if there was a bit of lining for a moderate amount of "privacy" during heavy exercise. Overall, I love this product and I buy it repeatedly when they get stained or stinky.
customer_reviews.author: MMN

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for busty women
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love this bra!!!! I am a 36D. I own the Enell Bra as well as the Juno and find this one to be the best. I plan to wear it for the triathlon that I do this summer. It's lightweight yet provides great support. I love that the straps are regular (and adjustable) as opposed to the racerback that the Juno has - makes it much easier to get on and off. Dries quickly. I have already purchased a second and will be buying a 3rd shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: A super supportive sports bra
customer_reviews.text: A super supportive sports bra. LIVED this after i had my babies. Straps are made with some super amazing velcro which you can loosen or tighten as needed andcthey actually stay in place. Easy to undo the strap if you need to nurse your baby mid-workout. Feed the kid, strap it up and youre good to go! My baby is 5 and i still wear it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Pammers

customer_reviews.title: supportive without the SMASH!
customer_reviews.text: I love LOVE LOVE this bra. I searched high and low for a bra to wear jogging while I was breastfeeding. I wanted something that was supportive, yet wouldn't smash my milk-full breasts, possible hurting or reducing my milk. I tried on A LOT of bras, and they all seemed to SMASH without support. This bra was all support and no smash. Would 100% recommend to anyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D.

customer_reviews.title: best I've found for larger sizes
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 38dd and this bra fit perfectly. It is very comfortable and easy to get on and off (which is NOT the case with all sports bras). This is my first Moving Comfort purchase and I'm quite pleased with it, as it minimizes discomfort during even vigorous exercise. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I wish there was just a little padding for modesty purposes. Otherwise this is the perfect sports bra, and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jess W.

customer_reviews.title: Not practical for larger sizes
customer_reviews.text: The material is high quality but not much support. This bra would probably be better suited for smaller sizes. I 'm in my 60's and I probably ordered too large of a size..... 44D
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great support and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I am medium busted and have had considerable trouble finding a suitable bra for very active exercise, esp. running. If it held me in place, it was not comfortable. This one is a keeper though - firm support but doesn't make me feel compressed. It is not particularly cool though. There is a very soft wicking layer next to the skin and it gets soaked quickly but I guess it would be impossible to get this type of support without the thicker fabric.
customer_reviews.author: birdiebyrd

customer_reviews.title: Like the bra , but small.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 36DD and they sent a 36D which was disappointing. It is pretty tight, so I added an extender to the back. That is my only complaint. There isn't alot of give to the bra. But I have to say that it is very comfortable, gives me a ton of support for jumping and doing aerobic exercises and really lifts my chest. Except for the sizing, I am really happy with this bra and this purchase. I would recommend it for larger chested women.
customer_reviews.author: NKB

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 34b. I read a bunch of reviews from larger busted women who liked this so I thought if it works for them... I'm a runner and horseback rider and got tired of having to wear a regular bra under my sports bra for enough support. The great thing is that this has hooks and eyes in the back. You don't have to tighten them too tight and make it hard to breath in order to get the support. Very comfortable for exercise.
customer_reviews.author: jkoch

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This bra received so many great reviews so I thought I had to try it, being a larger chested woman. However, it was probably the worst sports bra I have ever gotten. How can you wear this during high impact activities when it offers such little support? For me, I feel that I NEED an underwire in a sports bra and this obviously doesn't have that, but also doesn't offer the the level of support that it advertises either.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L Edinger

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: I'm liking these bras. The only complaint I have is that I now have a line where the bottom of the bra rubs against my torso. This line is there days after I use the bra, almost like a scar, even though it doesn't hurt at all and there is no discomfort while wearing it. It's hard to find a sports bra that fits properly in this size and this definitely does the job. It's completely adjustable as well.
customer_reviews.author: JoDee

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bra as my beloved Champion underwire sports bra was showing a lot of wear. I have never believed that someone my size (34DD) could ever wear a bra without an underwire. I read the reviews and was convinced to try it. I use it for zumba which is 60 minutes of nonstop dancing, jumping, etc. This bra was great! I could tell from the moment I put it on that it would be comfortable and would keep me from bouncing everywhere! I totally recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: bcms41

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bra for a larger bust
customer_reviews.text: After having my baby, my breasts ballooned from a 36C to 36DD. I purchased this bra for running, as I had some in the 36C size that I liked. Even as a DD, this bra still holds my breasts firmly and comfortably. I purchased a 36D to hold them tightly, since the top straps are adjustable. I also have some Champion T-Back sports bras that I like, but the Fiona is more supportive and probably worth the extra money. I think a big busted woman would be very satisfied with this sports bra.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Penny

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best sports bra I've ever come upon
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best sports bra I've ever come upon. This fits true to size and is very comfortable and extremely supportive. It comes up high on my so it's always visible with a v-neck t-shirt.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: perfect for the petite woman!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful purchase for those of us who are petite. I found the adjustable shoulder straps much more adjustable than your typical bra and that helps tremendously. My only caution for future purchasers is you may want to go a little longer on the inches than you might normally. I found that they seem to run a little tight in comparison with other brands I have purchased. Other than that, it fits very well and is everything I hoped for in comfort and support for all activities!
customer_reviews.author: K. W.

customer_reviews.title: Finally I found you!
customer_reviews.text: This bra is amazing and I love it. Bought it post partum because I needed lots of support but without too much squeeze. I've since bought it in another color and I don't think I'll ever look for another workout bra style. I use it for crossfit and have found that even as my bra size as changed with the end of breastfeeding and now being pregnant again, I can adjust it as needed. No flopping, no uniboob!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually a HIGH IMPACT sports bra
customer_reviews.text: I am a 32DD and a runner. This bra is excellent for high impact exercise. A lot of bras say that but this one fits the bill. I generally have a difficult time finding sports bras that fit well. This one works really well. The only issue is the strap. Adjusting the fit of the strap can cause bunching in an uncomfortable area. I've found that once the I have a fit that works, adjusting before I start to sweat prevents most of this discomfort. This issue is not enough of a downside to avoid this bra. The is almost no bouncing even during the hardest sprints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally met my sports bra match
customer_reviews.text: I am a 38D and I love this bra so much I own 3 of them and will probably buy a 4th next running season. This bra is the only kind that is NOT underwire that makes me feel like I don't even have breasts! Also important is that it's design separates my breasts just enough so they aren't touching (and so I don't get sweat build up in between). Also the straps are easily adjustable (size fluctuates monthly)!
customer_reviews.author: Allison F.

customer_reviews.title: Cup size is a little big
customer_reviews.text: I love these sports bras - they are very comfortable and look great. I normally wear a 34C, but ordered more in B instead. If you're between sizes, go with the smaller one. There are a few rows of 3 hooks in the back and the shoulder straps are adjustable (use strong velcro). Very well made - there is a band of softer material on the inside under the chest to capture sweat. Effective at preventing jiggling.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Most bras I buy don't fit right, anyway. ...
customer_reviews.text: Most bras I buy don't fit right, anyway. 38DD. This one fit me right for a sports bra. The straps are Velcro adjustable from the front and the band hooks in the back. The color was more of a fuchsia instead of blush which was a surprise. I wear it all the time when I need a sports bra. It is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: CoachLozada

customer_reviews.title: Best sports bra....ever!
customer_reviews.text: I usually do not review items because I forget or the item is just alright. I have struggled with finding a sports bra since high school and 10 years later I was still struggling to find something that supported me. This sports bra is absolutely fantastic. I had no idea how well one could fit my body and give me the support I wanted. I did go a cup size smaller (34C v 34D) than I normally wear because I wanted it to be snug and have room to stretch out a little. I could not be happier. I am buying 3 or 4 more today!
customer_reviews.author: Nikkilscott

customer_reviews.title: Sports Bra
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable sports bra I have ever worn. What I like about it is the straps are NOT criss/cross your back and are adjustable to your shoulder. Also the closure has 3 hooks and is adjustable as it ages. It washes nicely and fits like a standard bra but has the support needed for the active woman. I am disappointed in the shoulder straps on this bra. The elastic as it wears causes irritation to the skin...Would not buy again...
customer_reviews.author: Yknot

customer_reviews.title: Love it,  best bra I have ever had!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: No more bouncing and sore shoulders/back. Found the one that keeps the girls nice and snug. I am a 38D and I have tried dozens of sports bras over the years and they've all failed miserably, I usually end up throwing them out after a few months when they lose their shape. I'd used this bra a few times a week for the last 19 months, I wash it once every few wears and it has yet to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Mister'nMisses

customer_reviews.title: Okay for breatfeeding/nursing
customer_reviews.text: This is recommended to a lot of moms for breastfeeding and it works okay for that. The Velcro on the straps gives you easy access, but b/c the straps have to come completely out and fold under, it's not that easy to get fastened after nursing. With a few tweaks this would be a great nursing bra though...as a regular sports bra, it's great. Keeps everything right where it should be and it's comfy.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nye

customer_reviews.title: The best bra for women with breasts!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely fell in love with this bra when I bought one last year. This is easy to get on and off and keeps the girls from bouncing around when running outside or in gym. Very very comfortable. The adjustable straps in front make for an easy time of controlling the moving around quickly on the go. I have used many other bras over the years and will not use anything else again. NO woman should do any kind of moderate exercise without keeping the girls in place.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Moshenek

customer_reviews.title: The best sports bra ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sports bra for women with larger breast. I purchased this bra in 2010 and it still keeps everything still when I'm running. I have used other bras that squeeze me too tight or my breast look like a uni-breast, but this one doesn't do that. I like that the shoulder straps are adjustable with a strong Velcro - I don't have to worry about my heavy breast making that come loose with bouncing or running. I totally recommend this bra!
customer_reviews.author: L. Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Great Support--Works Well for Nursing
customer_reviews.text: My favorite sports bra! I had this in my normal size and had to size up after having a baby. Works well for my normal (c/d) size and pregnancy/postpartum (dd) size. It has triple hooks in the back and adjustable velcro straps. An added bonus is that the straps can be completely opened--hellllloooo nursing bra!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: Great support bra at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking and looking for a good support bra for working out and I was surprised at how impossible it is to find anything other than compression only bras even at hi-end sports stores. Finally, I realized I needed to go on-line and I quickly found this one on Amazon. I have NEVER bought a bra without trying it one but I decided to take a leap and try the Fiona bra after reading several good reviews. LOVED it! Plan on buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: Best Bra Ever
customer_reviews.text: For bigger busted women, this is it. Instead of a razorback style, the regular bra-like straps, along with the back closure, provides a nice, snug fit. On the front of the straps, there is velcro so that you can adjust the length. In another review, a user suggested buying one size smaller in order to create a tighter fit. I did this, and while it was tighter, there wasn't enough breast coverage for my taste. I returned the C and ordered a D (my size) and the coverage is perfect. If you practice high-impact sports/activities, my suggestion is to go with an over-the-shoulder sports bra like this one for added control, versus a razorback style.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Marie

customer_reviews.title: My favorite running bra!
customer_reviews.text: THIS BRA. It's the only running bra I've found that actually works with larger breasts. I can run in this without the painful bouncing. The Fiona keeps my boobs locked down and totally comfortable during my runs. I also love that t's not a v-neck - thsoe can make your neck and shoulders hurt if you've got big boobs. I highly recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Zornow

customer_reviews.title: I am 36DD/36DDD depending on the day and finding a sports bra that allows me to exercise and run without worry isn't easy, but t
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of searching around before buying this bra. I am 36DD/36DDD depending on the day and finding a sports bra that allows me to exercise and run without worry isn't easy, but this one is amazing. It does fit a little bit small, but not so small that buying my normal size was unwearable. I am able to run, do yoga, high cardio, etc without any issues and I will be buying many more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Levvish

customer_reviews.title: felt flimsier than Fiona from years past
customer_reviews.text: I know the Fiona is super popular, but in my opinion, the fabric feels less supportive on the Fiona bras than it did several years ago. I also thought the band size ran a little big, but this seems to vary based on color choice. Sent it back and the search for a no bounce bra continues.
customer_reviews.author: wkmoon

customer_reviews.title: Great for the well-endowed
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these bras and have to say that these are awesome. They don't give me the dreaded uni-boob, cut into me, and I can breath. They don't completely stop movement because you just simply can't with 32DDs. Things are always going to jiggle a little bit because it's not just the boobs that move, it's the skin around it that moves along with it! This is a great bra overall!
customer_reviews.author: GreenDoorD503

customer_reviews.title: Great for breastfeeding
customer_reviews.text: I got this bra after researching sports bras for running and nursing mothers. Regular nursing sports bras don't provide enough support for me for working out. This bra is perfect because it is a regular, supportive sports bra, but it also has adjustable bands with Velcro. The Velcro allows me to drop one cup at a time and easily feed my baby. It's even comfortable enough and easy enough to use that I've kept it on all day.
customer_reviews.author: E. Simpson

product_meta.title: Moving Comfort Women's Fiona Bra
product_meta.description:
Our #1 selling bra, the favorite that women buy in multiples, is always in the gym bag ready to wear. Front adjustable straps offer unsurpassed levels of comfort and custom fit.

Moving Comfort's most popular sports bra, the Fiona features seam-free molded cups with one-way stretch powermesh that encapsulates the breasts for support and limits up and down movement. This means that you can maintain the shape of your bust, while still receiving the high level of support and movement control that you expect from a sports bra. Two-way stretch powermesh on the back of the bra provides extra-firm support, while front adjustable straps with flattering design lines and a concealed hook-and-loop closure provide a perfect fit and enhance support. The wide-banded back will not bite into your sides and is fastened with three plush-backed hook-and-eye rows. Bras with bands sized 40 to 44 have a fourth row on the band. The Fiona Bra is constructed with fabrics that manage moisture for high-intensity activities.

 Designed for high-impact sports, the Fiona features combined encapsulation and compression support. The encapsulation bra cup construction surrounds the breast to give support and shaping, protecting the breast tissue from horizontal, vertical, and circular motion during sports. Compression bra construction redistributes breast tissue to evenly press against the chest wall limiting overall motion. The Fiona is an exceptional sports bra, designed to flatter a woman's form, while offering optimum fit and comfort performance.

 Specifications:

 * Seam-free molded cups 
 * One-way stretch Powermesh encapsulates in front 
 * Two-way stretch Powermesh in back 
 * Adjustable front straps 
 * Concealed front hook-and-loop closure on straps 
 * Three plush-backed hook-and-eye rows on band 
 * Fourth row on 40-44 bands 

 Support Type:

 * Compression: Bra cup construction that redistributes breast tissue to evenly press against the chest wall to limit motion 
 * Encapsulation: Bra cup construction that surrounds the breast to give support and shaping. Based on various degrees of impact, this structure helps to protect the breast tissue from horizontal, vertical, and circular motion during sports activities. 

 Material Specifications:

 * Body: 88 percent polyester, 12 percent spandex 
 * Interior Cups: 100 percent polyester 
 * Back Lining: Powermesh--83 percent nylon, 17 percent Lycra 
 * Front Yoke Lining: 90 percent nylon, 10 percent spandex 

 Care Specifications:

 * Machine washable 
 * Fasten the hooks before tossing them in the machine 
 * Hang dry 

 Find Your Fit:

 * Band: Should be slightly more snug than a lingerie bra. Make sure you can comfortably take a deep breath with the bra fastened on the middle hook. Be sure the band doesn't ride up in the back. If it does, the band may be too loose and/or the straps need to be adjusted. 
 * Cups: Adjust your breasts for a proper fit. They should be completely held within the cups without overflowing. Fabric should be smooth. Wrinkles or puckers indicate the cup is too big. Underwire should sit on your ribcage below the breast tissue and follow your natural shape. 
 * Straps: Should offer minimal stretch to reduce up-and-down breast movement. Wider straps will disperse the weight and feel more comfortable. Straps should not dig in or slide off your shoulders. Adjustable straps offer a more custom fit. 

 About Moving Comfort:
Two female runners founded Moving Comfort in 1977 before there were women's workout clothes. In the 30-plus years since the founding, the company hasn't strayed from its original purpose. Moving Comfort uses high-quality, performance fabrics that have the right amount of stretch, perfect quick-wicking moisture management, and a healthy amount of comfort--cut exactly for a woman's body.

 Moving Comfort follows the following guidelines in constructing high-performance athletic wear for women:

 Moving means moving: The how doesn't matter--running, walking, weight training, yoga, martial arts, skiing, snowshoeing, rock climbing, horseback riding, golf, tennis, basketball, volleyball, soccer, inline skating...Moving Comfort naturally understands and designs clothes for a woman's body, whatever that body was meant to do.

 Quality comes first: Moving Comfort understands the kind of support and freedom needed in clothing, and how that clothing should feel against the skin. The company knows what keeps women warm and dry when it's cold and cool and dry when it's hot. Knowledge, expertise and high standards shape the fit, fabric and function of every garment Moving Comfort designs.

 Fit affects everything: Keeping fit improves every aspect of a woman's life--reducing the incidence of heart disease, breast cancer, osteoporosis, depression, and drug and alcohol abuse. If a girl or woman is more comfortable when she's working out, she's more likely to keep at it. That's why Moving Comfort views its technical garments--and the great fit of each piece--as a means to encourage women to get fit and stay fit.
feature_bullets: Front adjustable straps with concealed hook-and-loop closure
